intro: Pseudomecodium oligosorum, commonly known as the slender pseudomecodium, is a rare and delicate flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of the Andes. It belongs to the family Onagraceae, which includes species such as willows and evening primroses. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or white in color. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in rocky or mountainous habitats. Due to its limited distribution and specific ecological requirements, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
